page.title: 03LOCAL AGRICULTURE: RANBY(2)
page.content: The techniques used to render these lands fertile were developed in North Norfolk, but had spread to Nottinghamshire by the mid 18th century. The Norfolk four-course rotation: turnips, barley, clover, wheat (and variations of it) enabled larger quantities of livestock to be reared. They provided the manure needed by these soils. Though expensive in fertilizers, the system was economic in view of the higher prices that followed the contemporary population increase, industrialisation and the growth of towns.
